tekstueel_bewijs: the risen Christ put it back together
Jesus is asking him... Jesus says, 'Feed my lambs'

object.identificatie: The restoration and transformation of the failed human (Peter/Hearer)
tekstueel_bewijs: how the risen Christ put it back together

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Gospel Reality
tekstueel_bewijs: the kind of death by which Peter would glorify God

ontvanger.identificatie: Peter and by extension the Hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: It’s supposed to change you and me
Peter is a kind of paradigm case study for us
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is invited to identify with the Receiver (the one being restored).

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Word (Eyewitness accounts)
tekstueel_bewijs: the Holy Spirit comes into your life
This story is strong evidence that the Gospels are eyewitness accounts
homo incurvatus in se... radically self-centered
the death of his allusions of self-sufficiency
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described not as a mistake but as a radical ontological curving of the self that only a 'death' can fix.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer (Peter) living out the resurrection life through service and suffering.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Restored Believer (Peter/Hearer)
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Feeding the sheep / Glorifying God through death
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/service) is strictly a consequence of the primary program (grace/restoration).

voorbeelden_god_subject: the risen Christ put it back together
Jesus cried, 'My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?'
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Peter says, 'I will never forsake you'
You have to submit to the pattern

voorbeelden: Don’t you want this kind of humility?
You have to understand the achievement
nothing equips you more... than your failure plunged into a sea of my grace
resurrection power... in our lives now

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes that human 'Pouvoir' (ability) is zero until the Subject (Jesus) grants it through the 'death' of the old self.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from Peter's Self-Sufficiency (~S1) to Total Failure (S2), then through Jesus' confrontation (not avoiding S2) into Grace (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Substitution: Jesus takes the 'forsakenness' (S2) so Peter can receive the Restoration (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; the sermon emphasizes the 'magnitude' and 'immensity' of the betrayal.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly rejects exemplarism and centers the 'engine' of change on Jesus' substitutionary work and the Spirit's power.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: You have to believe... You have to submit

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: If Jesus Christ came primarily as our example, he was a failure... He came as our Savior.
the risen Christ put it back together

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Peter is used as a 'case study' of failure, not a model of virtue. Jesus is the only hero.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God saves the broken.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic restoration; the believer is the beneficiary of Christ's action.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the primary program (salvation) to the secondary (ethics) is logically linked via the 'death-resurrection pattern'.
spanning_punten: The 'You have to' language slightly clashes with the 'Grace alone' message, though it is framed as a response to reality.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He came to live the life we should have lived and die the death we should have died.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit reorders the heart's loves (Augustinian model).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is a 'shame that can never be remedied' by human effort.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative structure is soundly theocentric. Jesus is the Subject of the restoration, and the hearer is the Receiver.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly heavy on 'Savoir' (understanding) in the four points.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase 'Vouloir' by emphasizing the beauty of Christ more.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Spend more time on the 'fish breakfast' as a sign of Jesus' tenderness.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in avoiding moralism while maintaining high ethical calls by rooting them in the actantial priority of Christ.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'four points'; semiotics shows the points are actually modal competencies for the Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek 'poimainō'; semiotics explains why that word functions as a transfer of 'Pouvoir' from Jesus to Peter.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'fire' is a semiotic site of transformation where the Opponent (Peter's ego) is defeated by the Subject (Jesus).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'You have to' as a rhetorical device, but the underlying actantial engine is 'Jesus does'.
